sources.title: "Scaramouche" (1923) director Rex Ingram starring Ramon Novarro
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     "Scaramouche" is a drama, adventure, romance and a swashbuckler. The events occur during the French revolution. The film is based on the novel by Rafael Sabatini. Directed by                Rex Ingram Produced by              Metro Pictures Corporation Scenario by                 Willis Goldbeck Based on                     the novel by Rafael Sabatini Starring                       Ramon Novarro, Alice Terry, Lewis Stone, Lloyd Ingraham, Julia Swayne Gordon, George Siegmann, Edith Allen, Snitz Edwards Cinematography        John F. Seitz Distributed by           Metro Pictures Corporation Release date               Febryary 1924 Running time             123 min. metadata.Plot: A law student becomes an outlaw French revolutionary when he decides to avenge the unjust killing of his friend. To get close to the aristocrat who has killed his friend the student adopts the identity of Scaramouche the clown.
metadata.Actors: Lloyd Ingraham, Alice Terry, Ramon Novarro
